channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: The U.S. is trying to unravel a hacking plot that targeted climate activists
item.description: The U.S. claims the hacking was commissioned by a lobbying firm working on behalf of one of the world's biggest oil companies.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. claims the hacking was commissioned by a lobbying firm working on behalf of one of the world's biggest oil companies.

(Image credit: Alberto Pezzali)
item.dc:creator: Michael Copley

item.title: 'Ugh. Do I have to?' Honest questions about cardio, illustrated
item.description: If you're in the camp of folks who are dragging their feet to start working out again, this comic is for you.
item.content:encoded: If you're in the camp of folks who are dragging their feet to start working out again, this comic is for you.
item.dc:creator: Marielle Segarra

item.title: What did Donald Trump throw to his inauguration crowd? Find out in the news quiz
item.description: Plus: Who got Oscar nods? What's Prince Harry up to? Who's watching Elon Musk? Is Barron Trump a cryptobro?
item.content:encoded: Plus: Who got Oscar nods? What's Prince Harry up to? Who's watching Elon Musk? Is Barron Trump a cryptobro?
item.dc:creator: Holly J. Morris

item.title: Trained dogs working inside hospitals help ease burnout among health care staff
item.description: Some hospitals are bringing in dogs to spend entire shifts with doctors and nurses. The trained canines help staff cope with the stress of their work amid high levels of burnout.
item.content:encoded:
Some hospitals are bringing in dogs to spend entire shifts with doctors and nurses. The trained canines help staff cope with the stress of their work amid high levels of burnout.

(Image credit: Hart Van Denburg)
item.dc:creator: John Daley

item.title: Experts warn about the 'crumbling infrastructure' of federal government data
item.description: Unstable federal funding puts at risk the government statistics used to track the U.S. economy and population, officials and data users warn. That's before any cuts by President Trump and Congress.
item.content:encoded:
Unstable federal funding puts at risk the government statistics used to track the U.S. economy and population, officials and data users warn. That's before any cuts by President Trump and Congress.

(Image credit: Brian Witte)
item.dc:creator: Hansi Lo Wang

item.title: Trump has tossed a lot of Biden policies. But there's one AI measure he wants to keep
item.description: President Trump says he likes Biden's idea to open up federal lands for AI data centers. His White House is looking for ways to ensure U.S. dominance in the sector.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he likes Biden's idea to open up federal lands for AI data centers. His White House is looking for ways to ensure U.S. dominance in the sector.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Deepa Shivaram

item.title: Progress is made on a huge fire north of LA as new fires erupt in Southern California
item.description: Evacuation orders were lifted Thursday for tens of thousands as firefighters slowed the spread of a huge wildfire in mountains north of Los Angeles, but new blazes erupted in San Diego County.
item.content:encoded:
Evacuation orders were lifted Thursday for tens of thousands as firefighters slowed the spread of a huge wildfire in mountains north of Los Angeles, but new blazes erupted in San Diego County.

(Image credit: Mark J. Terrill/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump mandates assassination records be released for the Kennedy brothers and MLK Jr.
item.description: Congress passed a law in 1992 requiring the documents surrounding President Kennedy's assassination to be released by 2017, but the release has been held up by national security concerns.
item.content:encoded:
Congress passed a law in 1992 requiring the documents surrounding President Kennedy's assassination to be released by 2017, but the release has been held up by national security concerns.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie

item.title: Novak Djokovic retires injured from Australian Open semifinal, as some fans boo
item.description: Tennis star Novak Djokovic was booed by some sections of the crowd after retiring injured from his Australian Open semifinal against German Alexander Zverev.
item.content:encoded:
Tennis star Novak Djokovic was booed by some sections of the crowd after retiring injured from his Australian Open semifinal against German Alexander Zverev.

(Image credit: Asanka Brendon Ratnayake)
item.dc:creator: Robbie Griffiths

item.title: Purdue Pharma and owners to pay $7.4 billion in settlement of lawsuits over OxyContin
item.description: Members of the family who own OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma, and the company itself, agreed to pay up to $7.4 billion in a new settlement to lawsuits over the toll of the prescription painkiller.
item.content:encoded:
Members of the family who own OxyContin maker Purdue Pharma, and the company itself, agreed to pay up to $7.4 billion in a new settlement to lawsuits over the toll of the prescription painkiller.

(Image credit: Douglas Healey/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
